resources.string: Welcome to Screenplay!\n\nThis is the initial Scene. Press the home button to navigate the other stages.
Creating simple page flows with Screenplay is easy. Going from one stage to another is as easy as calling Flow#goTo(newScene).
The Transformer class handles animations between stage views. The incoming and outgoing stages each get a separate animation.
When the animation completes, the old stage\'s view is removed from the window to free up memory.
You can use Flow to add multiple stages to the backstack at once, or move to a new backstack entirely.
This is the first stage added to the backstack.
This is the second stage added to the backstack. Press the back button to go back once, or the button below to go back twice.
This is the first (root) stage of the new backstack.
This is the second (topmost) stage of the new backstack.
Modals in Screenplay are just Views, and are 100% customizable. Click through to see the examples.
This is a modal stage that looks like a dialog. Like all modal stages, it will persist even if you add a new stage to the stack.
In this example, we pass a callback to a Scene and fire the callback when the view is detached.
Screenplay will retain the state of the backstack, even on device rotation. Try it!
